alert.note: Alert for Gaston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 6:42AM EDT until April 29 at 12:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County... .Heavy rain had fallen throughout the South Fork Catawba basin since yesterday resulting in steady river rises and developing flood conditions this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River At Lowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...As the river rises to near 11 feet, floodwaters will cover Riverside Park in Cramerton and inundate Goat Island Park. Floodwaters will approach Riverside Dr near 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton and may also approach homes along Catawba Run Rd., near the streamgauge. Hoyle Creek floodwaters, possibly due to backwater effects from the South Fork Catawba River, may begin to impact the Old Willis School Road bridge near Sandcastle Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 10.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
